item.title: Rundown: Multiyear Mask Study Concludes Surgical Masks Could Prevent Transmission of Coronaviruses and Influenza
item.description: A brief communication published yesterday in Nature Medicine concludes that “results indicate that surgical face masks could prevent transmission of human coronaviruses and influenza viruses from symptomatic individuals”. Study: "Surgical face masks significantly reduced detection of influenza virus RNA in respiratory droplets...Our results indicate that surgical face masks could prevent transmission of human coronaviruses and influenza viruses from symptomatic individuals" https://t.co/omXFMVD83b — Scott Gottlieb, MD (@ScottGottliebMD) April 3, 2020 This study began in 2013 and recruited participants with confirmed respiratory illness.
